meanings.definition: Make a noise characteristic of a hen.
meanings.sent1: The hen will bawk loudly in the morning.
meanings.sent2: I heard the chickens bawk when I entered the farm.
meanings.sent3: Why did the chicken bawk at the joke? It must have been funny!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter bawked through the room, filling it with joy.
meanings.sent5: The bawking of the hens woke me up at dawn.

meanings.sent1: He tends to bawk before making important decisions.
meanings.sent2: Don't bawk, just choose the one you like best.
meanings.sent3: She always seems to bawk when it comes to picking a movie.
meanings.sent4: His mind bawked at the thought of jumping off the cliff.
meanings.sent5: The student would bawk at answering the difficult question.

meanings.sent1: The bawk of the rooster echoed across the farm.
meanings.sent2: The sudden bawk startled the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent3: The bawk of the crow mixed with the chirping of the birds.
meanings.sent4: The bawk of the eagle pierced through the silence of the forest.
meanings.sent5: The loud bawk of the peacock caught everyone's attention.
